hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $530$ is one place to the left of the same digit in the number $53$.


Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$53$ | | $\swarrow\blueD{5}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{3}$  
$530$ | $\blueD5$ |$\greenD3$ |$0$

Moving each digit to the left means multiplying by $10$:  

$\blueD5\greenD30 = \blueD5\greenD3\times10$

question.content:
